candidates.title: style(hydro_deploy): use `name_of!` macro
refactor: remove `lazy_static` dependency
chore: lower min dependency versions where possible, update `Cargo.lock`
chore: drop unused dependencies
candidates.body:
---
[//]: # (BEGIN SAPLING FOOTER)
Stack created with [Sapling](https://sapling-scm.com). Best reviewed with [ReviewStack](https://reviewstack.dev/hydro-project/hydroflow/pull/1417).
* #1418
* __->__ #1417

candidates.title: refactor(hydro_deploy)!: rename integration crates to drop CLI references
feat(hydroflow_lang): allow `demux_enum` to have any number of outputs, fix #1329
feat(anna): blind gossip
candidates.body:
This change implements a blind gossip protocol where the gossipers don't receive (or care to receive) responses from the systems they gossip with. 

It also adds a deterministic testing framework for testing gossip.

Once request-reply is added, it can stop being blind.

candidates.title: feat(hydroflow_plus): use trybuild to compile subgraph binaries
feat(hydro_deploy): Add end-to-end flamegraph generation for macos and linux localhost, fix #1351
refactor(hydro_deploy)!: end-to-end flamegraph generation, fix #1365
candidates.body:
Depends on #1370

Fixes #1365

BREAKING CHANGE: changes PerfConfig creation and probably other stuff

candidates.title: refactor(hydro_deploy)!: `Deployment.stop()` for graceful shutdown including updated `perf` profile downloading
candidates.body:
* `perf` profile downloading moved from the `drop()` impl to `async fn stop()`
* download perf data via stdout
* update async-ssh2-lite to 0.5 to cleanup tokio compat issues

WIP for #1365

BREAKING CHANGE: to get `perf` data, calling `.stop().await` is now required.

candidates.title: fix(hydroflow_plus): overly restrictive input types for `send_bincode_interleaved`
candidates.body: The original types prevented usage in cluster-to-cluster communication.

candidates.title: refactor(hydro_deploy)!: use `buildstructor` to handle excessive `Deployment` method arguments, fix #1364
candidates.body:
Adds new method `Deployment::AzureHost`

BREAKING CHANGE: Changes syntax for `Deployment::GcpComputeEngineHost`

candidates.title: refactor(hydro_deploy)!: replace `async-channel` with `tokio::sync::mpsc::unbounded_channel`
style!: enable clippy `upper-case-acronyms-aggressive`
candidates.body:
* rename `GCP` -> `Gcp`, `NodeID` -> `NodeId`
* update CI `cargo-generate` template testing to use PR's branch instead of whatever `main` happens to be

candidates.title: refactor(hydro_deploy): build cache cleanup
candidates.body:
* Replace mystery tuple with new `struct BuildOutput`
* Replace `Mutex` and `Arc`-infested `HashMap` with `memo-map` crate, greatly simplifying build cache typing
* Remove redundant build caching in `HydroflowCrateService`, expose and use cache parameters as `BuildParams`
* Remove `once_cell` and `async-once-cell` dependencies, use `std`'s `OnceLock`
* Add `Failed to execute command: {}` context to `perf` error message
* Cleanup some repeated `format!` expressions

candidates.title: Merge hydro-project/hydroflow-template into this repo, for #1314
Merge hydro-project/hydroflow-plus-template into this repo, for #1314
feat(hydro_deploy)!: Perf works over SSH
candidates.body:
See documentation on how to use in [Notion](https://www.notion.so/hydro-project/perf-Measuring-CPU-usage-6135b6ce56a94af38eeeba0a55deef9c).

Fix #1353

BREAKING CHANGE: changes some config arguments

candidates.title: feat(anna): Adding configurable seed nodes.
candidates.body:
* Added support for hierarchical configuration using `config` crate & used it to set seed node information
* Some cleanup for types & interfaces

candidates.title: feat(anna): Server node adds itself to sys/members on start-up
candidates.body:
* Added a member metadata type to the protocol.
* Uses JSON serialization for now to keep things human-readable.
* Some clean-up - server main.rs doesn't contain the server or the server unit tests. It is a slim layer that limits responsibility to parsing command-line arguments and wiring network I/O. Business logic and tests moved to `server.rs.`

candidates.title: chore(anna): Logging setup for L0 data store.
feat(anna): Added a working CLI
candidates.body:
With this change, the water flows through the pipes, with Gets, Sets & Deletes primarily working. Some minor issues remain, but I'll do those separately.

Next steps:
https://github.com/hydro-project/hydroflow/issues/1253
https://github.com/hydro-project/hydroflow/issues/1257
https://github.com/hydro-project/hydroflow/issues/1256
https://github.com/hydro-project/hydroflow/issues/1255
https://github.com/hydro-project/hydroflow/issues/1254

candidates.title: feat(lattices_macro): add `#[derive(Lattice)]` derive macros, fix #1247
candidates.body:
This adds derive macros to allow user-created macros. Each field must be a lattice.

Example usage:
```rust
struct MyLattice<KeySet, Epoch>
where
    KeySet: Collection,
    Epoch: Ord,
{
    keys: SetUnion<KeySet>,
    epoch: Max<Epoch>,
}
```

Uses `#[derive(Lattice)]` for the `lattices` library `Pair` lattice.
Also contains some cleanup in the `lattices` crate.

candidates.title: feat(anna): Added a two-level data model for the layer zero key-value store.

repo.name: hydro
repo.description: A Rust framework for correct and performant distributed systems
